Uses of Interface
javaslang.control.Either

  • Packages that use Either 
    Package Description
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.

    • Uses of Either in javaslang.control

      Classes in javaslang.control that implement Either 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Left<L,R>
      The Left version of an Either.
      class  Right<L,R>
      The Right version of an Either.
      Methods in javaslang.control that return Either 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <X,Y> Either<X,Y> Either.bimap(Function<? super L,? extends X> leftMapper, Function<? super R,? extends Y> rightMapper)
      Maps either the left or the right side of this disjunction.
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> Either.left(L left)
      Constructs a Left
      static <L,R> Either<L,R> Either.right(R right)
      Constructs a Right
      Either<R,L> Either.swap()
      Converts a Left to a Right vice versa by wrapping the value in a new type.
      Either<L,R> Either.LeftProjection.toEither()
      Returns the underlying either of this projection.
      Either<L,R> Either.RightProjection.toEither()
      Returns the underlying either of this projection.
      default Either<Throwable,T> Try.toEither()
